definitions.definition: to (cause to) go or do something very quickly:
examples: I've been rushing (about/around) all day trying to get everything done.

definitions.definition: a situation in which you have to hurry or move somewhere quickly:
a time when a lot of things are happening or a lot of people are trying to do or get something:
examples: There's always a rush to get the best seats.

definitions.definition: the act of suddenly moving somewhere quickly:
examples: There was a rush of air as she opened the door.

definitions.definition: a sudden movement of people to a certain area, usually because of some economic advantage:
in American football, an attempt to run forwards carrying the ball, or an attempt to quickly reach and stop a player from the opposing team who is carrying the ball
